sanskrit_verse:
देवदत्तां पतिर्भार्यां विन्दते नेच्छयाऽत्मनः ।
तां साध्वीं बिभृयान्नित्यं देवानां प्रियमाचरन् ॥ ९.९५॥
transliteration:
devadattāṁ patir bhāryāṁ vindate necchayā'tmanaḥ |
tāṁ sādhvīṁ bibhṛyān nityaṁ devānāṁ priyam ācaran || 9.95||
sph_interpretive_translation: A husband who finds his wife, Devadatta, not desiring union with him must continually sustain her as a virtuous woman while performing actions dear to the gods.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in alignment with divine will, not personal desire.
Causation originates in consciousness, not physical action alone.
Capacity-based responsibility requires sustaining integrity regardless of reciprocal desire.
Restoration logic prioritizes harmony over possession or control.
Consciousness alignment demands adherence to dharma even when personal satisfaction is absent.
executable_legal_axioms: IF husband observes lack of conjugal desire FROM wife THEN husband MUST maintain sustenance AND uphold her dignity AS divine order.
IF conjugal expectation IS unmet THEN husband SHALL NOT withdraw support OR degrade status OF wife.
IF husband performs duties pleasing TO deities THEN societal harmony IS preserved REGARDLESS of private dissatisfaction.
IF either spouse exhibits disinterest IN union THEN both MUST continue dharmic conduct WITHOUT punitive response.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that marital obligations are not conditional upon mutual emotional or physical fulfillment but are grounded in the sustained performance of dharma. The threshold of responsibility lies in maintaining societal and cosmic order through individual adherence to duty, irrespective of personal inclination. Authority flows from alignment with Sanatana Dharma rather than contractual expectations.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that true causality stems from alignment with the divine will, not from coercive enforcement of desire. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that neglecting one's duty leads to sequential disharmony; thus proportional responsibility lies in continuous dharmic action. There is no punitive element—only the natural consequence of failing to align consciousness with eternal law.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process wherein husband reaffirms vow to protect wife without condition.
Engage responsibility assumption protocol where both spouses commit to dharmic living independently of desire.
Implement capacity restoration by guiding husband toward understanding service as an act of devotion.
Facilitate integrity reintegration via daily practices that elevate relationship beyond ego-driven needs.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands declared: Dharma prevails through conscious alignment with divinity, not through force or desire. Marriage endures by virtue of sustained righteousness. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth. All else follows.
